meanings.definition: To attack or destroy with nuclear weapons.
meanings.sent1: The enemy threatened to nuke our cities.
meanings.sent2: Countries must never nuke each other.
meanings.sent3: I accidentally nuked my dinner in the microwave.
meanings.sent4: Her words were like a nuke to his heart.
meanings.sent5: The explosion was so powerful, it felt like a nuke had gone off.

meanings.sent1: The country developed a new nuke for defense.
meanings.sent2: The nuke was disarmed to prevent disaster.
meanings.sent3: He joked about carrying a mini nuke in his pocket.
meanings.sent4: The threat of a nuke changed the course of history.
meanings.sent5: The scientist studied the components of a nuke carefully.

meanings.definition: To cook or heat in a microwave oven.
meanings.sent1: I need to nuke my leftovers for lunch.
meanings.sent2: She decided to nuke some popcorn for movie night.
meanings.sent3: He tried to nuke his socks to dry them faster.
meanings.sent4: The smell of nuked popcorn filled the room.
meanings.sent5: Don't forget to nuke the soup before serving.
